page.title: 12Beeby Self Pick Farm
page.content: Beeby Self Pick Farm is one of a new-breed of fruit and vegetable farms where the general public pick their own produce and pay on the basis of weight. This cuts down overheads for the farmer and gives people the pleasure of a day in the country. The cost of the fruit and vegetables is less than similar produce in the shops or on the market. 1lb of strawberries, for example, costs about 25 pence. To buy these in the shops would easily cost twice or three times this amount. The range of produce available at Beeby is very wide. Rhubarb, gooseberries, strawberries, raspberries, worcesterberries, boysenberries, whiteberries, cabbage, peas, broccoli, new potatoes, brussel sprouts and onions are available, amongst other things.
